name: RPA.Desktop
doc:
Desktop is a cross-platform library for navigating and interacting with desktop environments. It can be used to automate applications through the same interfaces that are available to human users.

The library includes the following features:

  • Mouse and keyboard input emulation
  • Starting and stopping applications
  • Finding elements through image template matching
  • Taking screenshots
  • Clipboard management
Note: Windows element selectors are not currently supported,
and require the use of RPA.Desktop.Windows

Locating elements

To automate actions on the desktop, a robot needs to interact with various graphical elements such as buttons or input fields. The positions of these elements can be found using a feature called locators.

A locator describes the properties or features of an element. This information can be later used to locate similar elements even when window positions or states change.

The currently supported locator types are:

Name Arguments Description
alias name (str) A named locator, the default.
image path (str) Image of an element that is matched to current screen content
coordinates x (int), y (int) Pixel coordinates as absolute position
offset x (int), y (int) Pixel coordinates relative to current mouse position

A locator is defined by its type and arguments, divided by a colon. Some example usages are shown below. Note that the prefix for alias can be omitted as its the default type.

Click    alias:SpareBin.Login
Click    SpareBin.Login

Move mouse    image:%{ROBOT_ROOT}/logo.png
Move mouse    offset:200,0
Click

Named locators

The library supports storing locators in a database, which contains all of the required fields and various bits of metadata. This enables having one source of truth, which can be updated if a website's or applications's UI changes. Robot Framework scripts can then only contain a reference to a stored locator by name.

The main way to create named locators is with Robocorp Lab.

Keyboard and mouse

Keyboard keywords can emulate typing text, but also pressing various function keys. The name of a key is case-insensitive and spaces will be converted to underscores, i.e. the key Page Down and page_down are equivalent.

The following function keys are supported:

Key Description
shift A generic Shift key. This is a modifier.
shift_l The left Shift key. This is a modifier.
shift_r The right Shift key. This is a modifier.
ctrl A generic Ctrl key. This is a modifier.
ctrl_l he left Ctrl key. This is a modifier.
ctrl_r The right Ctrl key. This is a modifier.
alt A generic Alt key. This is a modifier.
alt_l The left Alt key. This is a modifier.
alt_r The right Alt key. This is a modifier.
alt_gr The AltGr key. This is a modifier.
cmd A generic command button (Windows / Command / Super key). This may be a modifier.
cmd_l The left command button (Windows / Command / Super key). This may be a modifier.
cmd_r The right command button (Windows / Command / Super key). This may be a modifier.
up An up arrow key.
down A down arrow key.
left A left arrow key.
right A right arrow key.
enter The Enter or Return key.
space The Space key.
tab The Tab key.
backspace The Backspace key.
delete The Delete key.
esc The Esc key.
home The Home key.
end The End key.
page_down The Page Down key.
page_up The Page Up key.
caps_lock The Caps Lock key.
f1 to f20 The function keys.
insert The Insert key. This may be undefined for some platforms.
menu The Menu key. This may be undefined for some platforms.
num_lock The Num Lock key. This may be undefined for some platforms.
pause The Pause / Break key. This may be undefined for some platforms.
print_screen The Print Screen key. This may be undefined for some platforms.
scroll_lock The Scroll Lock key. This may be undefined for some platforms.

When controlling the mouse, there are different types of actions that can be done. Same formatting rules as function keys apply. They are as follows:

Action Description
click Click with left mouse button
left_click Click with left mouse button
double_click Double click with left mouse button
triple_click Triple click with left mouse button
right_click Click with right mouse button

The supported mouse button types are left, right, and middle.

Examples*

The library can open applications and interact with them through keyboard and mouse events.

*** Settings ***
Library    RPA.Desktop

*** Keywords ***
Write entry in accounting
    [Arguments]    ${entry}
    Open application    erp_client.exe
    Click         image:%{ROBOT_ROOT}/images/create.png
    Type text     ${entry}
    Press keys    ctrl    s
    Press keys    enter
    [Teardown]    Close all applications

Targeting can be currently done using coordinates (absolute or relative), but using template matching is preferred.

*** Settings ***
Library    RPA.Desktop

*** Keywords ***
Write to field
    [Arguments]    ${text}
    Move mouse   image:input_label.png
    Move mouse   offset:200,0
    Click
    Type text    ${text}
    Press keys   enter

keywords.name: Clear Clipboard
keywords.doc: Clear the system clipboard.
keywords.shortdoc: Clear the system clipboard.

keywords.name: Click
args: action: Action { click | left_click | double_click | ... } = Action.click
keywords.doc:
Click at the element indicated by locator.

param locator:Locator for click position
param action:Click action, e.g. right click

Example:

Click
Click    LoginForm.Button
Click    coordinates:500,200    triple click
keywords.shortdoc: Click at the element indicated by locator.

keywords.name: Click With Offset
args: action: Action { click | left_click | double_click | ... } = Action.click
keywords.doc:
Click at a given pixel offset from the given locator.

param locator:Locator for click start position
param x:Click horizontal offset in pixels
param y:Click vertical offset in pixels
param action:Click action, e.g. right click

Example:

Click with offset    Robocorp.Logo    y=400
keywords.shortdoc: Click at a given pixel offset from the given locator.

keywords.name: Close All Applications
keywords.doc:
Close all opened applications.

Example:

Open file    order1.docx
Open file    order2.docx
Open file    order3.docx
# Do something with Word
Close all applications
keywords.shortdoc: Close all opened applications.

keywords.name: Close Application
keywords.doc:
Close given application. Needs to be started with this library.

param app:App instance

Example:

${word}=    Open file    template.docx
# Do something with Word
Close application    ${word}
keywords.shortdoc: Close given application. Needs to be started with this library.

keywords.name: Copy To Clipboard
keywords.doc:
Read value to system clipboard from given input element.

param locator:Locator for element
returns:Current clipboard value

Example:

${value}=    Copy to clipboard    ResultPage.Counter
Log    Copied text: ${value}
keywords.shortdoc: Read value to system clipboard from given input element.

keywords.name: Define Region
keywords.doc:
Return a new Region with the given dimensions.

param left:left edge coordinate.
param top:top edge coordinate.
param right:right edge coordinate.
param bottom:bottom edge coordinate.
keywords.shortdoc: Return a new <tt class="docutils literal">Region</tt> with the given dimensions.

keywords.name: Drag And Drop
keywords.doc:
Drag mouse from source to destination while holding the left mouse button.

param source:Locator for start position
param destination:
 Locator for destination position
param start_delay:
 Delay in seconds after pressing down mouse button
param end_delay:
 Delay in seconds before releasing mouse button
keywords.shortdoc: Drag mouse from source to destination while holding the left mouse button.

keywords.name: Find Element
keywords.doc:
Find an element defined by locator, and return its position. Raises ElementNotFound if` no matches were found, or MultipleElementsFound if there were multiple matches.

param locator:Locator string

Example:

${match}=    Find element    image:logo.png
Log    Found logo at ${match.x}, ${match.y}
keywords.shortdoc: Find an element defined by locator, and return its position. Raises <tt class="docutils literal">ElementNotFound</tt> if` no matches were found, or <tt class="docutils literal">MultipleElementsFound</tt> if there were multiple matches.

keywords.name: Find Elements
keywords.doc:
Find all elements defined by locator, and return their positions.

param locator:Locator string

Example:

${matches}=    Find elements    image:icon.png
FOR    ${match}  IN  @{matches}
    Log    Found icon at ${match.x}, ${match.y}
END
keywords.shortdoc: Find all elements defined by locator, and return their positions.

keywords.name: Get Clipboard Value
keywords.doc:
Read current value from system clipboard.

Example:

Copy to clipboard       coordinates:401,198
${text}=    Get clipboard value
Log    We just copied '${text}'
keywords.shortdoc: Read current value from system clipboard.

keywords.name: Get Display Dimensions
keywords.doc: Returns the dimensions of the current virtual display, which is the combined size of all physical monitors.
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the dimensions of the current virtual display, which is the combined size of all physical monitors.

keywords.name: Get Mouse Position
keywords.doc:
Get current mouse position in pixel coordinates.

Example:

${position}=    Get mouse position
Log    Current mouse position is ${position.x}, ${position.y}
keywords.shortdoc: Get current mouse position in pixel coordinates.

keywords.name: Highlight Elements
keywords.doc: Draw an outline around all matching elements.
keywords.shortdoc: Draw an outline around all matching elements.

keywords.name: Move Mouse
keywords.doc:
Move mouse to given coordinates.

param locator:Locator for mouse position

Example:

Move mouse    Robocorp.Logo
Move mouse    offset:0,400
keywords.shortdoc: Move mouse to given coordinates.

keywords.name: Move Region
keywords.doc:
Return a new Region with an offset from the given region.

param region:the region to move.
param left:amount of pixels to move left/right.
param top:amount of pixels to move up/down.
keywords.shortdoc: Return a new <tt class="docutils literal">Region</tt> with an offset from the given region.

keywords.name: Open Application
keywords.doc:
Start a given application by name (if in PATH), or by path to executable.

param name_or_path:
 Name or path of application
param args:Command line arguments for application
returns:Application instance

Example:

Open application    notepad.exe
Open application    c:\path\to\program.exe    --example-argument
keywords.shortdoc: Start a given application by name (if in PATH), or by path to executable.

keywords.name: Open File
keywords.doc:
Open a file with the default application.

param path:Path to file

Example:

Open file    orders.xlsx
keywords.shortdoc: Open a file with the default application.

keywords.name: Paste From Clipboard
keywords.doc:
Paste value from system clipboard into given element.

param locator:Locator for element

Example:

Copy to clipboard       coordinates:401,198
Paste from clipboard    coordinates:822,710
keywords.shortdoc: Paste value from system clipboard into given element.

keywords.name: Press Keys
keywords.doc:
Press multiple keys down simultaneously.

param keys:Keys to press

Example:

Press keys    ctrl  alt  delete

Press keys    ctrl  a
Press keys    ctrl  c
${all_text}=  Get clipboard value
Log    Text box content was: ${all_text}
keywords.shortdoc: Press multiple keys down simultaneously.

keywords.name: Press Mouse Button
keywords.doc: Press down mouse button and keep it pressed.
keywords.shortdoc: Press down mouse button and keep it pressed.

keywords.name: Read Text
keywords.doc:
Read text using OCR from the screen, or an area of the screen defined by the given locator.

param locator:Location of element to read text from
keywords.shortdoc: Read text using OCR from the screen, or an area of the screen defined by the given locator.

keywords.name: Release Mouse Button
keywords.doc: Release mouse button that was previously pressed.
keywords.shortdoc: Release mouse button that was previously pressed.

keywords.name: Resize Region
keywords.doc:
Return a resized new Region from a given region.

param region:the region to resize.
param left:amount of pixels to resize left edge.
param top:amount of pixels to resize top edge.
param right:amount of pixels to resize right edge.
param bottom:amount of pixels to resize bottom edge.
keywords.shortdoc: Return a resized new <tt class="docutils literal">Region</tt> from a given region.

keywords.name: Set Clipboard Value
keywords.doc:
Write given value to system clipboard.

Example:

Set clipboard value     This is some text.
Paste from clipboard    coordinates:822,710
keywords.shortdoc: Write given value to system clipboard.

keywords.name: Set Default Confidence
keywords.doc:
Set the default template matching confidence.

param confidence:
 Value from 1 to 100
keywords.shortdoc: Set the default template matching confidence.

keywords.name: Set Default Timeout
keywords.doc:
Set the default time to wait for elements.

param timeout:Time in seconds
keywords.shortdoc: Set the default time to wait for elements.

keywords.name: Take Screenshot
keywords.doc:
Take a screenshot of the whole screen, or an element identified by the given locator.

param path:Path to screenshot. The string {index} will be replaced with an index number to avoid overwriting previous screenshots.
param locator:Element to crop screenshot to
param embed:Embed screenshot into Robot Framework log
keywords.shortdoc: Take a screenshot of the whole screen, or an element identified by the given locator.

keywords.name: Type Text
keywords.doc:
Type text one letter at a time.

param text:Text to write
param modifiers:
 Modifier or functions keys held during typing
param enter:Press Enter / Return key after typing text

Example:

Type text    this text will be uppercase    shift
keywords.shortdoc: Type text one letter at a time.

keywords.name: Type Text Into
keywords.doc:
Type text at the position indicated by given locator.

param locator:Locator of input element
param text:Text to write
param clear:Clear element before writing
param enter:Press Enter / Return key after typing text

Example:

Type text into    LoginForm.Name      Marky Mark
Type text into    LoginForm.Password  ${PASSWORD}
keywords.shortdoc: Type text at the position indicated by given locator.

keywords.name: Wait For Element
keywords.doc:
Wait for an element defined by locator to exist, or raise a TimeoutException if none were found within timeout.

param locator:Locator string

Example:

Wait for element    alias:CookieConsent    timeout=30
Click    image:%{ROBOT_ROOT}/accept.png
keywords.shortdoc: Wait for an element defined by locator to exist, or raise a TimeoutException if none were found within timeout.

keywords.name: Wait For Element To Disappear
keywords.doc:
Wait for an element defined by locator to disappear.

Example:

Wait for element to disappear    alias:LoadingScreen    timeout=30
Click    image:%{ROBOT_ROOT}/main_menu.png
keywords.shortdoc: Wait for an element defined by locator to disappear.
